sub_title: Professor of International Aviation Financing and Leasing Laws and Of Counsel at Rep Law Aviation
summary: Patrick Honnebier is one of the few aircraft finance lawyers having obtained the benefits of both worlds. While he is a long-standing academic, he also has vast practical expertise in realising international aviation finance and lease transactions. The combination of extensive scholarly legal knowledge and its direct application in practice makes him a well-rounded aircraft finance lawyer. Honnebier is one of the founder-members of Rep Law Aviation and based in Amsterdam. He advises major manufacturers, banks, lessors and airlines in relation to international financing and leasing of aircraft, helicopters and engines. At the Master of Laws (LL.M.) in Air and Space Law program of the University of Mississippi (Ole Miss), School of Law, he is the responsible Professor of the unique Full Semester course International Aviation Financing and Leasing Laws. As a guest lecturer, he addresses the conflict of laws rules covering aircraft finance transactions at Groningen University, the Netherlands. For +14 years, he instructed the students in international aircraft financing law at the International Institute of Air and Space Law, Leiden University. At Utrecht University and the University of Aruba he lectured on corporate/commercial law. Honnebier attended the Diplomatic Conference for the realization of the Convention on International Interest in Mobile Equipment and the Aircraft Equipment Protocol (Cape Town Convention, 2001). He was the expert legal counsel of the Governments of Aruba, the former Netherlands Antilles and the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs concerning the adoption by the Kingdom of the Netherlands of the Cape Town Convention on 1 September, 2010. He was external legal adviser of the government of the Netherlands concerning the innovative implementation of the de-registration of aircraft (IDERA) provisions of the Cape Town Convention in the (Caribbean) Netherlands. Consequently, the regulation covering the registration of civil aircraft in the Netherlands has been amended on April 1, 2020. It provides for a procedure which is not yet enacted in any other jurisdiction at the global level! He is the author of numerous articles being published in all the leading air law journals. He was Editor of Journaal Luchtrecht/Netherlands Journal of Air Law until its demise. Frequently and worldwide, the last time being invited by the Arab Civil Aviation Authority (ACAO) to address effects of the Russia-Ukraine crisis in Casablanca, Morocco from 14-17 June 2022, he is a speaker at international aviation finance conferences and presenter at related webinars

treasury_media.title: Arab Civil Aviation workshop Casablanca Morocco 14 - 17 June 2022.jpg
treasury_media.description: The workshop organized by the Arab Civil Aviation Organization in Casablanca, Morocco from 14-17 June 2022. The focus of the meeting was on international aviation financing and leasing laws. The topics which I addressed were the goal and sphere of application of the Cape Town Convention. More specifically, ample consideration was given to the legal, practical and political issues that arise due to the Russia-Ukraine crisis in the Member States of the ACAO which are NOT 'sanction-jurisdictions'.

company.name: Rep Law Aviation Cooperatief, U.A. (Rep Law Aviation)

profile_positions.company: Rep Law Aviation Cooperatief, U.A. (Rep Law Aviation)
profile_positions.description: In 2017 I joined Rep Law Aviation Cooperatief U.A. (Rep Law Aviation), which is  is a legal organization established under the laws of the (European) Netherlands. Rep Law Aviation is the only Dutch organization which exclusively focuses on all the aspects of (international) aviation law. While it is domiciled in Amsterdam, its professional legal services are provided in all the territorial units of the Kingdom of the Netherlands. More specifically, our aviation-team has a track record representing leading trusts, banks and other financiers, lessors, airlines, manufacturers, governments, regulatory bodies in the territorial units Aruba, European Netherlands, Caribbean Netherlands (Bonaire, Statia and Saba), Curaçao and St Maarten.
profile_positions.title: Co-Member and Co-Founder

company.name: University of Mississippi (Ole Miss), School of Law, LL.M. in Air & Space Law

profile_positions.description: Professor of the course International Aviation Financing and Leasing Laws at the University of Mississippi (Ole Miss), School of Law, Master in Air and Space Law (LL.M.) program. In the whole world it is the only complete course covering this significant area of aviation law which is offered by a leading academic institution. The first class of students has graduated on 10 May, 2014. Twice a week, the students actively participate in the course. In addition, several leading international aviation finance and lease professionals share their unrivalled expertise. From their own offices, which are located worldwide, these guest-lecturers provide their top-rated lectures. Their vast knowledge concerning various aspects of international aviation and finance leasing transactions substantially contributes to the tremendous success of the unique course. The course is offered annually. Qualified individuals can take this course separately from the Ole Miss full legal curriculum. The lectures can be  followed by the students on campus in Oxford, Mississippi. Alternatively, the course also matches the needs of students having full-time jobs as they can actively participate in all the classes. This is noteworthy as worldwide the aviation and space law program of Ole Miss is the only one of its kind providing for both long-distance learning and modern information and communication technology. Besides, the University of Mississippi, School of Law is the only academy in the United States offering an American Bar Association accredited LL.M. degree in Air and Space Law.
